studyTitle: Trial of Endovascular Therapy for Acute Ischemic Stroke with Large Infarct.
author: Xiaochuan Huo et al.
primaryOutcome: Score on the modified Rankin scale at 90 days (scores range from 0 to 6, with higher scores indicating greater disability)
primaryOutcomeResults: Shift in the distribution of scores on the modified Rankin scale toward better outcomes was observed in favor of endovascular therapy over medical management alone (generalized odds ratio, 1.37; 95% confidence interval, 1.11 to 1.69; P = 0.004)
conclusion: Patients with large cerebral infarctions had better outcomes with endovascular therapy administered within 24 hours than with medical management alone but had more intracranial hemorrhages.
gPTSummary: 1 ratio to either endovascular therapy and receive medical management or to receive medical management alone.
